docna.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Industrial Sector Project :
            Credit 1816 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Bangladesh - Industrial Sector
            Project : Credit 1816 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
In order to attain the objective of
            achieving high rates of industrial growth to meet domestic
            demand, expand exports and create employment outside
            agriculture, the Government has agreed to undertake a major
            industrial policy reform program Which this credit supports.
            The reform program covers (a) developing and improving
            administrative and financial arrangements for implementation
            of export policies; (b) rationalizing the structure of
            protection; and (c) liberalizing the investment approval
            system.  The program further involves (d) improving the
            central monitoring of the performance of public enterprises,
            while granting them more autonomy and strengthening their
            management; and (e) improving the efficiency of the
            industrial credit system. This credit provides foreign
            exchange to finance general imports.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Government of Bangladesh (GOB) has
            recently undertaken many important measures to promote
            non-traditional exports. The major areas of reform proposed
            in this paper are: a) assurance of free and unrestricted
            imported inputs for export industries; b) easy access to
            export financing; c) maintenance of a realistic exchange
            rate for exporters; d) development of backward linkages from
            non-traditional exports; e) dealing with the import
            restrictions imposed by developed countries; and f)
            promotion of foreign direct investment and technology
            transfer in non-traditional export industries. In
            Bangladesh, some announced policies have never been
            implemented. This report focuses on issues related to (a)
            through (d) with the objective of assisting GOB to develop a
            medium-term strategy for non-traditional export promotion
            based on the findings of the IPC-14 pre-appraisal mission
            which visited Bangladesh from October 5 to 22, 1985.
